isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9400, AND 9900 MODELS - CATERPILLAR C-10, C-12 AND 3406E ENGINES - OPERATION - COOLANT LEVEL SENSOR

svcproc.title: COOLANT LEVEL SENSOR
svcproc.para: The coolant level sensor (402) is a fluid-level-actuated switch that senses continuity through the fluid to provide a warning when coolant is being lost. It is mounted in the coolant surge tank.
The coolant level switch connects to a 2-pin connector (402) on the International engine harness. Both circuits go through the engine harness to connector (400).
